source.ab74276f:
#Comparation between goalkeepers
comparationGoalKeepers=pd.DataFrame()
statsCourtois=fifaDataset[(fifaDataset['Nationality'] == "Belgium"  ) & (fifaDataset['Name'] =="T. Courtois"  ) ]
statsKawashima=fifaDataset[(fifaDataset['Nationality'] == "Japan"  ) & (fifaDataset['Name'] =="E. Kawashima"  ) ]
comparationGoalKeepers=comparationGoalKeepers.append(statsCourtois)
comparationGoalKeepers=comparationGoalKeepers.append(statsKawashima)
comparationGoalKeepers.dropna(axis=1, how='all')
source.0ca491a1:
#Comparation between centre-backs:
#Comparation between Toby Alderweireld (in this game he played as right-back but his main position is centre-back ), Jan Vertoghen (in this game he played as left-back),
#Gen Shoji and Maya Yoshida.
comparationCentreBacks=pd.DataFrame()
statsVertonghen=fifaDataset[(fifaDataset['Nationality'] == "Belgium"  ) & (fifaDataset['Name'] =="J. Vertonghen"  ) ]
statsAlderweireld=fifaDataset[(fifaDataset['Nationality'] == "Belgium"  ) & (fifaDataset['Name'] =="T. Alderweireld"  ) ]

comparationCentreBacks=comparationCentreBacks.append(statsVertonghen)
comparationCentreBacks=comparationCentreBacks.append(statsAlderweireld)


statsShoji=fifaDataset[(fifaDataset['Nationality'] == "Japan"  ) & (fifaDataset['Name'] =="G. Shoji"  ) ]
statsYoshida=fifaDataset[(fifaDataset['Nationality'] == "Japan"  ) & (fifaDataset['Name'] =="M. Yoshida"  ) ]

comparationCentreBacks=comparationCentreBacks.append(statsShoji)
comparationCentreBacks=comparationCentreBacks.append(statsYoshida)

comparationCentreBacks

source.38b6f7f3:
#separate target from predictors
y=fifaDataset.Overall
columns=['Age', 'Skill Moves', 'Work Rate', 'Position', 'Crossing', 'Finishing',
'HeadingAccuracy', 'ShortPassing', 'Volleys', 'Dribbling', 'Curve', 'FKAccuracy', 'LongPassing', 'BallControl', 'Acceleration', 'SprintSpeed', 'Agility', 'Reactions', 'Balance','ShotPower', 'Jumping', 'Stamina', 'Strength', 'LongShots', 'Aggression', 'Interceptions', 'Positioning', 'Vision', 'Penalties', 'Composure', 'Marking', 'StandingTackle', 'SlidingTackle', 'GKDiving', 'GKHandling', 'GKKicking', 'GKPositioning', 'GKReflexes']
X=fifaDataset[columns]

#divide data into training and validation subsets
X_train_full, X_valid_full, y_train,y_valid=train_test_split(X,y,train_size=0.70, test_size=0.30,random_state=0)
source.b051f93e: categorical_columns=[column_name for column_name in X_train_full.columns if X_train_full[column_name].dtype=="object"]
source.969894e6: numerical_columns=[column_name for column_name in X_train_full.columns if X_train_full[column_name].dtype in ["int64", "float64"]]
source.6ff6f7fc:
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder

# Preprocessing for numerical data
numerical_transformer = SimpleImputer(strategy='mean')

# Preprocessing for categorical data
categorical_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
    ('imputer', SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')),
    ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'))
])

# Bundle preprocessing for numerical and categorical data
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numerical_transformer, numerical_columns),
        ('cat', categorical_transformer, categorical_columns)
    ])
source.28ce84a7:
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
fifaModel = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=200, random_state=0)
pipelineFifa = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor),
                              ('model', fifaModel)
                             ])

source.5506191f:
* **Tatsuya Ito, 22 years old.**

His main position is left winger, and he can also play as right winger and attacking midfield. Good speed and dribbling, he plays for Sint-Truidense, although this season he isn't having much minutes to play. About his injuries, according to Transfermarkt, he hasn't suffered any injury of interest. He had thigh problems at the season 18/19, but nothing serious, the injury lasted for 3 days.

source.cb487b9f:
# **Chapter 5. Predicting overall of a player according to his statistics.**

I'm going to develop a simple model which is going to use these statistics to predict the overall punctuation of the player: Age, Skill Moves, Work Rate, Position, Crossing,HeadingAccuracy, ShortPassing, Volleys, Dribbling, Curve, FKAccuracy, LongPassing, BallControl, Acceleration, SprintSpeed, Agility, Reactions, Balance,ShotPower, Jumping, Stamina, Strength, LongShots, Aggression, Interceptions, Positioning, Vision, Penalties, Composure, Marking, StandingTackle, SlidingTackle, GKDiving, GKHandling, GKKicking, GKPositioning, GKReflexes.
source.82cdc0b7:
* **Takehiro Tomiyasu, 21 years old**. 

He's now playing for FC Bologna. This is an interesting player because he can play as right back, centre-back or even defensive midfield. He is very tall and strong, fast, a brilliant protector of the ball and he has a nice air game. For his actual club he is playing mostly as a defensive right back, although he has been playing as centre the most part of his career (Sint-Truidense, Japan National Team,etc). About his injuries, according to Transfermarkt, he had this season a biceps femoris muscle injury, from Oct 11, 2019 to Nov 16, 2019. He also had a bruised knee at the season 18/19 but I think this is not an injury of interest because it was probably caused by a hit.
source.ff564ad7: Which are the popular positions in the game between Japanese young players in general?
source.40190396:
**Data Analysis-Japanese players**

A lot of folks were surprised when Real Madrid signed Takefusa Kubo, who was playing for F.C.Tokyo. But for the followers of Japanese football it was not a surprise because Japan has been increasing its football quality during the last years. Not only Takefusa, but players like Takumi Minamino, Hiroki Abe, Ritsu Doan,Takehiro Tomiyasu, Daichi Kamada...They have earned a place in the most competitive leagues. 

This analysis is comprenhed by these chapters:

* [Chapter 1. Inspection of the dataset](#section-one)

* [Chapter 2. Analyzing the potential of japanese young players](#section-two) 

* [Chapter 3. Comparation between young players of Europe and japanese young players](#section-three) 

* [Chapter 4. Comparation of Japanese national team and Belgium national team](#section-four)

* [Chapter 5. Designing a machine learning model to predict overall of the players](#section-five)
source.3e6e6e4e:
I'm going to explain some of these parameters for people who doesn't know much about FIFA.

-ID: unique id for every player

-Work rate: attack work rate/ defence work rate

-LS, ST, RS: they are the different positions in the field; left striker, striker, right striker...

-FK Accuracy: free kick accuracy.

-Acceleration: how long it takes a player to reach their maximum speed.

-Sprint speed: how fast is the player.

-Reactions: how easy a player can act after an event (an entry from an opponent, etc).

-Balance: the probability that a player will remain standing during a physical duel.

-Strength:  the probability that a player will succeed in a physical challenge.

-GK parameters: goalkeeper parameters.

* **Hiroki Abe, 21 years old.**

He has an exit clause of €40m while member of Barcelona B, otherwise the clause will be of €100m. His main position is left winger. He can also play as right winger and centre forward. His goal production has increased significantly during this season, he has already scored 4 goals, when in his last seasons the maximum number of goals that he had scored in national leagues during last seasons was 4. According to Transfermarkt, he has not suffered any injury of interest.
source.c5f8c27b:
# **Chapter 2: Analyzing the potential of japanese young players.**

A-First I'm going to look for the japanese young players with most potential. For that, I'm going to use the attributes Potential, and I'm going to select players from the youngest age to 22 years old, for example.

Potential is the predicted maximum overall rating for a young player, which can be reached if the player is allowed to reach his potential and is trained adequately.

source.260011e4:
As I expected, Takefusa Kubo (now 18 years old) is the player with most potential, followed by Ritsu Dōan (21). Takehiro Tomiyasu is the 3rd player with most potential. These three players have the following values in TransferMarkt: 15,00 mill.€(Takefusa), 8,00 mill. €(Ritsu),10,00 mill. € (Takehiro).

I would like to speak more about some of the players of this graph. (I will skip Kubo and Dōan because they are well known players).
source.d58d7605:
* **Daichi Kamada, 23 years old.**

He plays as attacking midfield, although he can also play as second stricker or central midfield. This player has become an important piece of the Eintracht Frankfurt club. He was signed by this team in 2017 for a four year contract, in the season 18/19 he was loaned to Sint-Truiden where he scored 16 goals for the team. This season 19/20 he already plays for the Eintracth Frankfurt and he has scored 4 goals. He is a strong and fast player with a good dribbling and shot. Moreover, he has a high IQ in the field. No past important injuries according to Transfermarkt.

source.80c5c4f4:
The players who played for Belgium were: Thibaut Courtois , Toby Alderweireld, Vincent Kompany, Jan Vertonghen, Thomas Meunier, Kevin De Bruyne, 
Axel Witsel, Yannick Carrasco (subted at 65'), Dries Mertens (subted at 65'), Romelu Lukaku, Eden Hazard and the changes were Marouane Fellaini and Nacer Chadli.


The players who played for Japan were: 	Eiji Kawashima, Hiroki Sakai, Maya Yoshida, Gen Shoji, Yuto Nagatomo, Makoto Hasebe, Gaku Shibasaki(subted at 81'), Genki Haraguchi (subted at 81'), Shinji Kagawa, Takashi Inui, Yuya Osako and the changes were Hotaru Yamaguchi and Keisuke Honda. 

These were the line-ups of each team: https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331551/#match-lineups
source.e316eac7: Takefusa has a lot of potential, but right now the player with a better Overall is Ritsu Doan, followed by Daichi Kamada and Takehiro Tomiyasu.
source.762b5ba8:
Kubo has more potential than Martin Ødegaard, and if we check the data his stats are better in Work rate, Acceleration, Heading Accuracy,  Sprint Speed, Agility, Balance,Jumping, Stamina, Strength, Aggression, defensive parameters( standing tackle, sliding tackle, marking).


Let's take now one of the players mentioned before: Tatsuya Ito. Remember that his main position was left winger. Let's compare him then with a famous young left winger: David Neres from Ajax.
